column5: Which CNCF Project(s) are you maintaining?

column68: What services do you wish the CNCF provided that it doesn't currently?*
column69: Any other feedback that you wish to share, from what CNCF can do more or what we should do less?

Service Mesh and Storage are two areas needs CNCF guidance and sensitivity for the benefit of the community not the vendors.

column65: As businesses fund open source projects with the ultimate goal of monetization in mind, I feel that the community greatly benefits from the shelter/protection that a neutral foundation can provide. In addition, the CNCF ecosystem and community is very strong, with lots of experienced folks that can help to advise and provide project guidance.
column66: A program like GSoC would be great
column67: Website help - we received some a year or two ago but it still looks pretty woeful.  Help getting our docs in order... IMO it's related to marketing in the same way that the website is.  Visibility at KubeCon - as a sandbox project, we don't get much. We've historically had many talks at KubeCons past but for some reason only one got through this year in North America even though many quality talks were submitted. I don't expect the selection committee to be required to select CNCF project talks, however this year definitely feels like we got a little cold shouldered for whatever reason.
column68: Help with technical writing. Our docs need some serious love and they are badly impacting the project optics.
